p: As for KHFD, after a one week-incubation period, a first clinical phase of infection, begins with several symptoms including fever, chills, headache, muscular pain, rash, and cervical adenopathy. After two weeks a neurological syndrome appears sometimes accompanied by a hemorrhagic syndrome with severe platelet loss and leucopenia. A third of patients develops pneumonia, nephritis, meningitis, or a combination of these complications. The CFR ranges from 1 to 10Â %, surviving patients acquire life-long immunity
